meanings: 작별 I'm sorry but I should get going.
작별 It's a pity but I have to go.
작별 It is unfortunate but I must go now.
초대와 방문 I'm afraid I can't make it that day.

meanings.meaning: time to love you and leave you

examples.korean: Recent personal difficulties have put more demands on my time than I can put into full-time work, and sadly, I have been forced to make this reluctant decision. 듣기 Add to Wordbook 최근 저의 개인적인 문제들에 많은 시간이 요구되어 업무에 전적으로 집중하기 어려운 이유로, 아쉽지만 마지못해 이 결정을 내리게 되었습니다. DARAKWON
examples.english: Recent personal difficulties have put more demands on my time than I can put into full-time work, and sadly, I have been forced to make this reluctant decision. Add to Wordbook

examples.korean: I am afraid I must say bye. 듣기 Add to Wordbook 아쉽지만 작별 인사를 해야겠어요. YBM All in All English-Korean Dictionary
examples.english: I am afraid I must say bye. Add to Wordbook

examples.korean: It's too bad we forgot to bring the bowls[plates], but let's make do with these. 듣기 Add to Wordbook 그릇을 안 챙겨 와서 아쉽지만 그럭저럭 이것으로 씁시다. Neungyule
examples.english: It's too bad we forgot to bring the bowls[plates], but let's make do with these. Add to Wordbook

examples.korean: I'm afraid it's time to say good-bye. 듣기 Add to Wordbook 아쉽지만 이제는 헤어져야 할 시간입니다. Neungyule
examples.english: I'm afraid it's time to say good-bye. Add to Wordbook

examples.korean: Unfortunately, no. I'm working on a report, and I'll have to work late every night this week to meet my deadline. 듣기 Add to Wordbook 아쉽지만 안 되겠네요. 보고서를 쓰고 있는데 마감일까지 끝내려면 이번 주 내내 야근을 해야만 해요. YBM All in All English-Korean Dictionary
examples.english: Unfortunately, no. I'm working on a report, and I'll have to work late every night this week to meet my deadline. Add to Wordbook
